comments: T(i,j) is the number of i-permutations of 11 objects a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k, with repetition allowed, containing j a's. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 21 2007Triangle T(n,k), read by rows, given by [10,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,...] DELTA [1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. [From _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 15 2009]
references: B. N. Cyvin et al., Isomer enumeration of unbranched catacondensed polygonal systems with pentagons and heptagons, Match, No. 34 (Oct 1996), pp. 109-121.
formula: Sum_{k, 0<=k<=n} T(n,k)*x^k = (10+x)^n. [From _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 15 2009]G.f.: -1/(-1+10*x+x*y). - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 11 2015
maple: for i from 0 to 8 do seq(binomial(i, j)*10^(i-j), j = 0 .. i) od; - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 21 2007
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
